name: Luana Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A better B+B cannot be found on the Big Island.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful

likes.liked: — Toss up between amazing views and Ken and Erin's hospitality
likes.disliked: — Winding road off highway 11...but Kona abounds in these narrow, winding roads

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luana Inn:
reviews.title: Loved the Luana Inn B&B

likes.liked: — Location and forgot to mention Internet access!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We definitely recommend Luana Inn for people who like snorkeling, beaches, ocean views, good quality accommodations, and friendly hosts.
reviews.title: A Piece of Paradise!
Great Hospitality
reviews.text: You know what they say: location, location, location, and that's what Luana Inn was for us. That is what we were looking for, and what we got, plus some nice extras.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: It is on the west Coast of Hawaii, about a half and hour's drive south of Kona in Captain Cook. And minutes to the two best snorkel spots on the island: Kealakekua Bay (approx. 5 min by car). and Two Step (by Honaunau Place of Refuge) (approx15). Check your snorkel books for these spots. From here you don't have to go back into Kona to hire a tour that will take you back into the bay, just rent a kayak and go across (it's approx 1 mile or 20 minute paddle). Luana Inn was located below the main highway (on Napo'opo'o road) overlooking the ocean. I believe it was closer to the ocean than the highway, if you are trying to pinpoint it on a map.
reviews.title: A Real 5 star experience

likes.disliked: — Distance to attractions (it's a big island)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights so that we could explore the South Kona area. We wanted a place far from the resort/spa/hotel scene around Kailua and that's exactly what we got. Luana Inn is 3.5 miles off the highway and just .8 miles from the "beach". "Beach" is in quotes
reviews.title: Great place, great people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: because there's no sand. It is possible, however, to clamber over the rocks and into the water so you can swim or snorkel. The room was spacious and extremely comfortable, if a little spartan in the art/decor. The breakfast buffet was a real treat. Ken and Erin always had something which they had just baked, as well plenty of fresh fruit, granola, etc. The bottomless pot of Kona coffee was excellent! Ken and Erin are among the nicest, most accommodating B&B hosts we have ever encountered. They are also extremely knowledgeable
reviews.title: Simply wonderful
True Island style
reviews.text: about the area, especially the local restaurant scene. We took a couple of their recommendations and were very, very pleased. The only even mildly negative thing to be said about Luana Inn has to do with the way it was built (by the previous owner). The rooms in the main house are on ground level and open directly to the outdoors, where the other guests are walking around. This means you have to keep the curtains closed if you like to walk around your room naked. It's a small price to pay. When you *do* open the curtains there is a magnificent 180-degree view of the west coast of Hawaii. If you want a quiet, restful stay away from "the scene" on the Big Island, this is the place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: We found the Luana Inn on the 'Net and stayed for 2 nights, but regretted we couldn't extend our stay. The new owners, Erin and Ken, are doing a fantastic job of keeping their guests totally content.
reviews.title: Perfect every day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view from our room, across a lovely patio and swimming pool, 300' down to the ocean was unforgettable! Breakfasts are staged in their spacious professional kitchen above the guest rooms and feature their seasonal home-grown fruits and veggies, Kona coffee, eggs, teas and a choice of cereals, juices and their homemade breads.
reviews.title: Great b&b, location, and hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After travelling for a month in Hawaii - the Luana Inn remains my favourite B&B of all the islands!!!! - and I'd love to be back there right now!
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B in a brilliant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: Erin and Ken were great hosts. Apart from those wonderful home cooked brekkies, they let us know the secret local beaches around the area, and we had some wonderful beach days. The snorkelling around here is superb - clear waters, and plenty of fish, and even Manta Rays!
reviews.title: We highly recommend Luana Inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The B&B itself is set up in the hills about a mile from the beach. All first class comfort, plus the little extras like a cookie on arrival! We watched the sunset from the hot tub on evening, and barbecued on another.
reviews.title: Lovely Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Highly recommend this B&B.
reviews.title: Luana Inn- can't be beat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great service and hospitality, gourmet breakfasts, beautiful views and most of all Erin and Ken make us want to return.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Relax or Explore the Surrounding Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Erin and Ken’s guesthouse is a real gem. We immediately felt at home and like part of the family. We were thrilled with the genuine warmth of their hospitality, with their delicious homemade breakfasts (with homegrown fruit included and excellent Kona coffee), as well as with their polite, unobtrusive, and welcoming ways. Our room was comfortable and the bathroom especially well lit and spacious. Wifi internet access is free and reliable. The location is terrific: a short drive to Manini beach, which is swimmable, and provides some excellent snorkeling and views of spinner dolphins; a short drive to “Two-step,” which features some of the best snorkeling in the State. In general, the South Kona region is packed with excellent restaurants and beautiful views/beaches, where the turtles patrol the coast and where the dolphins range a little further out. Erin and Ken provide a superb guide to the area, which includes lists of their favorite restaurants (we were never disappointed), and they are always happy to give you further advice in conversation. Erin and Ken let you rent snorkel gear for 10 dollars per person for your entire stay. This was our honeymoon and it turned out to be one of the very best vacations of our lives—thanks in large part to the efforts of our friendly and gracious hosts.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Luana for a few days in July to use as a base for exploring Captain Cook and Kona. Erin and Ken are extremely friendly and welcoming, and their breakfasts are killer. We loved having such delicious options each morning. Plus, the views are amazing -- we spent an afternoon just relaxing by the pool while overlooking the ocean; it was extremely enjoyable. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are very clean. In addition, they provide tons of gear options for your to borrow for the beach! The Luana is well located for easy access to some of the best snorkeling beaches on the Big Island. We really enjoyed our time at the Luana and would certainly stay here again on our next visit to the Big Island.
reviews.title: Amazing Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Luana as a small family group in June-July 2013 - and liked it so much that we came back during the last leg of our two-week stay. It's a perfect base, and all the positive reviews are well-deserved. Luana is sunny, warm and welcoming, and at the same time very professionally-run by Erin and Ken. A tasty, filling and nutritious breakfast made an excellent start to each day and it was great to chat with Erin as she moved around making sure that everything was all that it should be. It was very handy to have access to washers and dryers - and there were lots of other small thoughtful details - like the grocery shopping bags in the Alihi suite so that we could easily stock up. We stayed in almost all of the rooms so can say that our favourites were the Alihi and Alaula, which fit our group perfectly.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There seems to be two ways to visit Hawaii's Big Island. There's a stretch of beach, not even a couple miles long, that seems to have dozens of hotels and resort-type things all right next to each other, with little shops and restaurants all within walking distance. If you're just there for the beach, and don't really care about the rest of the island (or don't want to rent a car), this might be a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Luana Inn, Hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other thing you could do, though, if you have a car, is find a bed and breakfast among any of the small towns near the island's coast. If this is what you're doing, and I strongly encourage you to do it this way, then you should go to Captain Cook and stay at the Luana Inn.
reviews.title: Great little Bed and Breakfast on the Big Island!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Erin and Ken run a superb property in the Captain Cook area on the big island. There are amazing views of the ocean at sunset. The breakfast is delicious and the rooms have a nice private feel with optional A/C. Even though check-in was at1500, Erin was nice enough to let us drop off our bags before noon and our bags were automatically delivered to our room once it was ready; what generous service!
reviews.title: Wonderful Views and Accommodating Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a fantastic four night stay with Erin and Ken and their two boys. They thought of all the little details that you need when you are away from home. Breakfast was a gourmet treat each morning. The location was central to all the sights on that side of the island and the views from the property were spectacular.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spend 5 wonderfull nights at Luana Inn. It is located in a remote area, 30 driving minutes south of the more touristy city of Kailua Kona and close by to several very nice snorkeling spots. To Manini beach you can even walk and watch the dolfins in the morning. Snorkeling gear can be rented at the B&B. Other main attractions on the island, like Volcano National Park or Mauna Kea can be reached within 2 to 3 hours max.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the Makani Room with a great view over the ocean with spectacular sunsets and the pool and hot tub nearby. The room was very tidy and clean, equipped with a little kitchen, including a fridge, pool/beach towels, a welcome snack and welcome/guide book with lots of information and recommendations about the surroundings and fun stuff to do.
reviews.title: Great hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We very much enjoyed the breakfast, with fresh fruits and home made pancakes, yummy muffins, quiche, bread and tasty local Kona coffee and much more. During the breakfast we planned our day based on recommendations from the helpfull and obliging hosts Erin and Ken and could exchange experiences with other guests. The breakfast was always a good start into the day!
reviews.title: Toni and Andrew, 4 nights at Luana Inn, then off to oahu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My gentleman friend and I stayed at The Luana Inn in June 2013 and were very pleased with our visit there.
reviews.title: If you like great views & delicious breakfasts...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was our first trip to Hawaii, and staying in a small town with hosts who know the area definitely enhanced our experience of the Big Island (as opposed to staying at a resort).
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ken & Erin are both great cooks, making fresh baked goods most mornings, serving fresh local fruit, and providing delicious Kona coffee. They're also happy to accommodate dietary restrictions.
reviews.title: We'll definitely be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ken is not afraid to talk politics at the breakfast table, which we appreciated. And speaking of breakfast tables, the communal dining area is set up so that you can easily have an intimate breakfast, or sit at a bigger table and talk with other guests.
reviews.title: Tops!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: There are only five rooms at the Inn, so it doesn't feel overwhelmingly busy, even when the Inn is full. We enjoyed meeting travelers from other parts of the world and the US.
reviews.title: Great location on the big Island

description: The Luana Inn Bed and Breakfast offers five spacious, elegant guest rooms, excellent amenities, and a panoramic ocean view. Located at 300 feet elevation, the Inn offers seclusion and privacy, and is within walking distance (.8 mi) of Kealakekua Bay. Amenities include swimming pool and hot tub, wireless broadband internet access, laundry & BBQ facilities, guest office, and guest great room.
